headline.main: Smaller U.S. Businesses Fear Freeze From EU Privacy Ruling
headline.print_headline: Smaller U.S. Businesses Fear Freeze From EU Privacy Ruling

docs.snippet: U.S. businesses from online coupon company RetailMeNot Inc to security software company Symantec Corp said a European change to rules governing transatlantic personal data transfers would hurt U.S. companies and called for a quick fix....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. businesses from online coupon company RetailMeNot Inc to security software company Symantec Corp said a European change to rules governing transatlantic personal data transfers would hurt U.S. companies and called for a quick fix.

headline.main: Judge OKs Muslim Film Ads Rejected by New York Subway Agency
headline.print_headline: Judge OKs Muslim Film Ads Rejected by New York Subway Agency

docs.snippet: A federal judge gave a green light Wednesday to light-hearted subway advertisements promoting a documentary about American Muslim comedians, saying a transportation agency improperly labeled them political in nature....
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge gave a green light Wednesday to light-hearted subway advertisements promoting a documentary about American Muslim comedians, saying a transportation agency improperly labeled them political in nature.

headline.main: Brazil's Attorney General to Appeal Ruling Against Rousseff
headline.print_headline: Brazil's Attorney General to Appeal Ruling Against Rousseff

docs.snippet: Brazil's Attorney General Luis Adams said on Wednesday the government will appeal the Federal Accounts Court decision against President Dilma Rousseff with the Supreme Court....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's Attorney General Luis Adams said on Wednesday the government will appeal the Federal Accounts Court decision against President Dilma Rousseff with the Supreme Court.

headline.main: In ‘The Assassin,’ a Director Blends the Fantastical and the Realistic

docs.snippet: The director Hou Hsiao-Hsien has made a film rooted in martial arts, but with imagery and settings that make “The Assassin” feel almost painterly....
docs.lead_paragraph: The director Hou Hsiao-Hsien has made a film rooted in martial arts, but with imagery and settings that make “The Assassin” feel almost painterly.

headline.main: Journalist Found Guilty for Aiding Computer Hackers
headline.print_headline: Journalist Found Guilty for Aiding Computer Hackers

docs.snippet: A California jury found journalist Matthew Keys guilty on three criminal counts related to helping members of the Anonymous hacking collective gain access to a former employer's computers, a spokeswoman for the U.S. Department of Justice said on W...
docs.lead_paragraph: A California jury found journalist Matthew Keys guilty on three criminal counts related to helping members of the Anonymous hacking collective gain access to a former employer's computers, a spokeswoman for the U.S. Department of Justice said on Wednesday.

headline.main: No Decision Made on No-Fly Zone in Syria: U.S. State Department
headline.print_headline: No Decision Made on No-Fly Zone in Syria: U.S. State Department

docs.snippet: There has been no decision to move forward with a no-fly zone in Syria, the U.S. State Department said on Wednesday, following reports that Secretary of State John Kerry has raised the option of a no-fly-zone to protect civilians....
docs.lead_paragraph: There has been no decision to move forward with a no-fly zone in Syria, the U.S. State Department said on Wednesday, following reports that Secretary of State John Kerry has raised the option of a no-fly-zone to protect civilians.

headline.main: Clinton to Detail Sweeping Plan to Rein in Wall Street
headline.print_headline: Clinton to Detail Sweeping Plan to Rein in Wall Street

docs.snippet: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton on Thursday will unveil a sweeping plan to curb what she has said are the abuses of Wall Street, proposing everything from raising the fines that can be levied by regulators to requiring execu...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton on Thursday will unveil a sweeping plan to curb what she has said are the abuses of Wall Street, proposing everything from raising the fines that can be levied by regulators to requiring executives to bear some of those costs.

headline.main: Singer Julio Iglesias Calls Donald Trump 'a Clown'
headline.print_headline: Singer Julio Iglesias Calls Donald Trump 'a Clown'

docs.snippet: Julio Iglesias has jumped into the U.S. political debate, calling Donald Trump "a clown" over the Republican presidential candidate's derogatory comments about Mexican migrants....
docs.lead_paragraph: Julio Iglesias has jumped into the U.S. political debate, calling Donald Trump "a clown" over the Republican presidential candidate's derogatory comments about Mexican migrants.

headline.main: Woman Draws Gun, Shoots at Shoplifter's SUV at Home Depot
headline.print_headline: Woman Draws Gun, Shoots at Shoplifter's SUV at Home Depot

docs.snippet: Police say a woman in a Home Depot parking lot fired shots at the SUV of a fleeing shoplifter in southeastern Michigan....
docs.lead_paragraph: Police say a woman in a Home Depot parking lot fired shots at the SUV of a fleeing shoplifter in southeastern Michigan.
